metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10190 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was discovered in DNS resolver component of knot resolver through version 3.2.0 before 4.1.0 which allows remote attackers to bypass DNSSEC validation for non-existence answer. NXDOMAIN answer would get passed through to the client even if its DNSSEC validation failed, instead of sending a SERVFAIL packet. Caching is not affected by this particular bug but see CVE-2019-10191.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10190` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

knot-resolver - 5.6.0-1
knot-resolver-module-http - 5.6.0-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> According to the advisory only affects version between (and including) 3.2.0 and 4.0.0 so only disco + eoan affected

criterions.comment: knot-resolver package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1').
